meanings.definition: To withdraw more money from a bank account than is available
meanings.sent1: I accidentally overdraw my account when I spent too much on snacks.
meanings.sent2: She had to pay a fee because she would overdraw her account.
meanings.sent3: I didn't mean to overdraw my account, but I really wanted that new toy.
meanings.sent4: His generosity would overdraw his account of goodwill with constant demands.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overdraw can lead to financial trouble.

meanings.definition: To draw or depict (a picture or design) with too much detail or exaggeration
meanings.sent1: The artist tends to overdraw the eyes in his portraits.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overdraw the flowers in her paintings for emphasis.
meanings.sent3: The cartoonist would overdraw the character's expressions for comedic effect.
meanings.sent4: The illustrator would overdraw the scenery to create a dreamlike atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: Overdrawing the features can make the artwork look unrealistic.

meanings.definition: To extend or stretch beyond the normal limits
meanings.sent1: I had to overdraw the rubber band to launch the paper airplane.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast would overdraw her splits to impress the judges.
meanings.sent3: He would overdraw his excuses to avoid taking responsibility.
meanings.sent4: The speaker would overdraw her points to emphasize the importance.
meanings.sent5: Overdrawing the line can lead to misunderstandings.
